flawed_nl_solution:
If Ann has 60 cards, which is 6 times as many cards as Heike, Heike has 60/6= <<60/6=10>>10 cards.
Anton has 3 times as many cards in his collection as Heike does, and since Heike has 10 cards, Anton has 10*3=<<3*10=30>>30 cards.
Ann has 60-30=<<60-30=28>>28 more cards than Anton.
#### 28

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 30, not 28. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
